description: Bringing together law students, practitioners, and tech experts to explore the impact of technology on legal practices, including workshops on AI in law and blockchain contracts.
location: Faculty of Law, St. George Campus

description: A networking event for students in bioengineering and related fields to meet with industry leaders, startups, and research institutions offering internships and job opportunities.
location: Terrence Donnelly Health Sciences Complex, St. George Campus

description: Interactive workshop designed to equip students with tools and methodologies to create impactful social enterprises, featuring guest speakers from successful nonprofits and social startups.
location: Innovation Lab, Rotman School of Management, St. George Campus

description: Annual conference discussing current global issues, diplomacy, and international policy, with panels, debates, and keynote speeches from distinguished diplomats and scholars.
location: Munk School of Global Affairs, St. George Campus

description: Showcase of digital art and design projects by UofT students, including virtual reality experiences, digital illustrations, and interactive installations.
location: Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, and Design, St. George Campus

description: Forum focusing on sustainable urban development, featuring discussions on green infrastructure, urban policy, and community planning with city planners and UofT faculty.
location: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, and Design, St. George Campus

description: A weekend retreat focusing on mental health and well-being, offering workshops on mindfulness, yoga sessions, and talks on managing stress during studies.
An opportunity for undergraduate philosophy students to present their papers and research, engage in philosophical debates, and attend keynote lectures by renowned philosophers.
location: Department of Philosophy, St. George Campus

description: A 24-hour hackathon where students use technology to solve social issues, focusing on themes such as accessibility, environmental sustainability, and community support. Teams will have the opportunity to present their solutions to a panel of experts.
location: Bahen Centre for Information Technology, St. George Campus

description: An evening of relaxation and mindfulness practices integrated with live classical music performances, aiming to promote mental health and well-being among students.
location: Hart House, Music Room, St. George Campus

description: A symposium dedicated to exploring sustainable technologies and green innovations. Features industry leaders, startups, and academic researchers discussing topics such as renewable energy, green computing, and sustainable materials.
location: Myhal Centre for Engineering Innovation & Entrepreneurship, St. George Campus

description: This festival celebrates literary creativity with readings by student and guest poets and authors, workshops on creative writing, and panel discussions on literature's role in society.

Bringing together data enthusiasts from across disciplines, this conference features workshops on data analysis tools and techniques, presentations on cutting-edge data science research, and networking opportunities with industry professionals.
location: Leslie Dan Faculty of Pharmacy, St. George Campus

description: A day-long event featuring workshops, exhibitions, and interactive projects aimed at promoting sustainability on campus and beyond. Topics include waste reduction, sustainable living, and campus green initiatives.
